12:46 <StefanS\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <StefanS\_> Hi all, i get a memory leak on v4.4 (OS FreeBSD 9.1) wath can i do ?  
13:13 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <cjd> Hi StefanS\_, what makes you think it's leaking memory?  
13:23 <cjd> XWiki uses a lot of memory for caching to speed up requests for common pages so use of <= 500 MB is expected  
13:27 <jvelo> has quit  
13:27 <StefanS\_> cjd, i foun this on stoud.log  
13:27 <StefanS\_> failed to remove it when the web application was stopped. This is very likely to create a memory leak  
13:27 <StefanS\_> and 100% CPU  
13:31 <cjd> The issue with the tomcat log is known, it's not a memory leak in the sense of eating up more and more memory as time goes by, what tomcat is complaining about is that when XWiki is shut down something doesn't get removed properly so stopping an individual webapp while leaving the jvm running might cause issues.  
13:31 <StefanS\_> OK, wath can i do ?  
13:32 <cjd> When you stop XWiki just stop the JVM and it will be fine.  
13:32 <StefanS\_> but wath is the reason ??  
13:32 <cjd> 100% cpu usage is expected for a short period because the integrated search engine needs to catalog all of the pages, how long is it running at 100%.  
13:33 <StefanS\_> more at 15min.  
13:47 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <jvelo> has quit  
14:01 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <jas02> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <jas02> Hi, I need to index external page included into the Xwiki using html macro and <iframe>. My question is, it's possible with Solr indexing engine?  
14:18 <jvelo> jas02: not out of the box  
14:19 <jvelo> Solr indexing engine is experimental anyway for the moment  
14:19 <jvelo> but it's definitely possible  
14:19 <jvelo> a "rendered content" indexing mode/option would interesting actually  
14:22 <jas02> jvelo: And it's stable enough to be deployed in production enviroment?  
14:22 <jvelo> no  
14:22 <jvelo> it's still in development  
14:23 <jvelo> right now the default search engine is lucene  
14:23 <jas02> And it's because of instablility of Solr itself or it's because implementation in Xwiki?  
14:24 <jvelo> it's because we are not done implementing it in XWiki  
14:24 <jvelo> we aim at replacing the lucene plugin with the new sold module ultimately  
14:24 <jvelo> solr  
14:25 <jas02> jvelo: OK, thanks for the info. Last question, is there some roadmap when will be Solr stable enough for production?  
14:25 <jvelo> that should happen in the 5.x cycle I think, though I'm not sure what's the plan  
14:25 <jvelo> Eduard would know but he's not here today it seems  
14:26 <jas02> Right now, is there some other option to index external html content?  
14:27 <jvelo> out of the box not really  
14:28 <jas02> jvelo: Thank's for the information  
14:28 <jvelo> no problem  
14:29 <jvelo> if you hang around here I'm interested in discussing with Eduard hooks for indexing external content easily in Solr  
14:29 <jvelo> it sounds like a common use case  
14:31 <jas02> has left #xwiki  
14:33 <rrodriguez> has quit
